title: Crucial problems in U.S. politics as of 2018
summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Immigration and lowest at Response Environment/ global warming.
The Share of respondents of Response Immigration is 6.0% larger than the minimum value at Environment/ global warming.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 16 number of Responses.
The maximum Share of respondents 12.0 is found at Response Immigration and the minimum is found at Environment/ global warming where Response is 2.0.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Immigration and lowest at Response Environment/ global warming.
The Share of respondents of Response Immigration is 6.0% larger than the minimum value at Environment/ global warming.
max_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 12.0 is found at Response Immigration and the minimum is found at Environment/ global warming where Response is 2.0.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Donald Trump.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 10.0.
Share of respondents at Response Immigration is 12.0 , second place is Donald Trump at 8.0, and thirdly is Donald Trump at 8.0.
Response Unemployment/ lack of jobs, Distribution of wealth / Inequality, Education/ schools/ affording education, and Foreign policy (general) have the same Share of respondents.
The Response Environment/ global warming tends to be 2.56 percent lower than average.
The Share of respondents is 75.0 if we add up values of all Responses.
